activities.name: Informed consent
activities.description: Informed consent from the participant or the participant's legal guardian MUST be obtained prior to any study-related procedures.

activities.name: Assessment of eligibility
activities.description: Assessment of eligibility

activities.name: Demographics
activities.description: Demographics include sex, race, ethnicity, and date of birth (year of birth only).

activities.name: Weight
activities.description: Weight measurement

activities.name: Height
activities.description: Height measurement

activities.name: Medical, surgical, and hemophilia history
activities.description: Includes hemophilia history assessment of disease severity, blood type, and Rh factor.

activities.name: FVIII activity (1-stage aPTT assay)
activities.description: FVIII activity (1-stage aPTT assay)

activities.name: Genotype
activities.description: Collection of samples for genotype analysis.

activities.name: In-clinic BIVV001 dosing
activities.description: BIVV001 delivered via a slow push IV injection.

activities.name: Physical exam
activities.description: Physical examination

activities.name: Vital signs
activities.description: Blood pressure, pulse rate, respiratory rate, and temperature.

activities.name: Pregnancy testing
activities.description: Serum or urine pregnancy test for female participants.

activities.name: HIV, HBV, and HCV status
activities.description: Viral testing performed at a central laboratory.

activities.name: CD4 count, viral load
activities.description: For participants known to be HIV antibody positive.

activities.name: Hematology
activities.description: RBC, WBC, platelet count, hemoglobin, and hematocrit.

activities.name: Coagulation parameters
activities.description: Includes activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT).

activities.name: Clinical chemistry
activities.description: ALT, AST, ALP, GGT, bilirubin, BUN, creatinine, glucose, etc.

activities.name: von Willebrand Comprehensive Panel
activities.description: Assessments of VWF ristocetin cofactor activity and VWF antigen.

activities.name: Nijmegen-modified Bethesda assay (inhibitor assay)
activities.description: Inhibitor assay performed by central laboratory.

activities.name: Anti-rFVIIIFc-VWF-XTEN Antibody (ADA)
activities.description: Testing for potential ADA formation.

activities.name: HJHS joint assessments
activities.description: Haemophilia Joint Health Score.

activities.name: Investigator's target joint assessment
activities.description: Assessment of target joints according to ISTH criteria.

activities.name: Physician's global assessment of response to treatment (PGA)
activities.description: Physician's global assessment of response to treatment.

activities.name: Ultrasound joint assessments
activities.description: Anatomical structural joint-health assessment via ultrasound imaging.

activities.name: Serum and plasma samples (optional)
activities.description: Samples archived for future research.

activities.name: Electronic patient diary (ePD) training / administration/ review
activities.description: ePD training and review.

activities.name: Abbreviated pharmacokinetic Sampling
activities.description: PK sampling after the first dose of BIVV001.

activities.name: Sequential pharmacokinetic sampling
activities.description: Extensive PK sampling at Baseline and Week 26.

activities.name: FVIII peak and trough sampling
activities.description: Peak and trough sample collected pre and post injection.

activities.name: PROMIS Assessments
activities.description: Pain Intensity, Pain Interference, and Physical Function.

activities.name: Haem-A-QoL (≥17 years old) or Haemo QoL (<17 years old)
activities.description: Quality of Life assessments.

activities.name: HAL (≥18 years old) or pedHAL (<18 years old)
activities.description: Hemophilia Activities List.

activities.name: TSQM-9
activities.description: Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire for Medications.

activities.name: Patient Global Impression of Severity (activity and joint)
activities.description: Patient perception of activity and joint health.

activities.name: Patient Global Impression of Change
activities.description: Patient Global Impression of Change.

activities.name: EQ-5D-5L
activities.description: Health-related quality of life questionnaire.

activities.name: Treatment Preference Survey
activities.description: Patient preference questions.

activities.name: Physical Activity Monitor (ActiGraph Activity Monitor)
activities.description: Triaxial medical grade accelerometer worn on the nondominant wrist.

activities.name: Exit interview
activities.description: Interviews conducted with a subset of participants.

activities.name: Healthcare Resource Utilization
activities.description: Healthcare Resource Utilization.

activityGroups.name: Safety
activityNames: Prior and concomitant medications and concomitant therapies and procedures

activityGroups.name: Efficacy
activityNames: Physician's global assessment of response to treatment (PGA)
Investigator's assessment of participant's response to treatment of bleeding episodes treated at the study site
Electronic patient diary (ePD) training / administration/ review
Participant's completion of ePD including at-home dosing, bleeding episodes, and assessment of response to treatment of bleeding episodes

activityGroups.name: Participant-Reported Outcomes
activityNames: Haem-A-QoL (≥17 years old) or Haemo QoL (<17 years old)
HAL (≥18 years old) or pedHAL (<18 years old)
Patient Global Impression of Severity (activity and joint)
